publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1118 Pauline McNeill: Childhood Sexual Abuse-That the Parliament recognises the complex, devastating and long term effect of childhood sexual abuse on children and adult survivors; further notes that childhood sexual abuse has an immense impact on society as a whole and calls upon the Scottish Executive to develop and implement a national strategy addressing the social, health and legal implications of sexual abuse and provide central support to develop a network of agencies throughout Scotland to support survivors of sexual abuse.
S1M-1118 Childhood Sexual Abuse (lodged on 10 August 2000) Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-1118 Childhood Sexual Abuse (lodged on 10 August 2000) Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-1118 Childhood Sexual Abuse (lodged on 10 August 2000) Irene Oldfather*
S1M-1118 Childhood Sexual Abuse (lodged on 10 August 2000) Michael Russell*

S1M-1118 Pauline McNeill: Childhood Sexual Abuse-That the Parliament recognises the complex, devastating and long term effect of childhood sexual abuse on children and adult survivors; further notes that childhood sexual abuse has an immense impact on society as a whole and calls upon the Scottish Executive to develop and implement a national strategy addressing the social, health and legal implications of sexual abuse and provide central support to develop a network of agencies throughout Scotland to support survivors of sexual abuse. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Irene Oldfather, Michael Russell
S1M-1118 Childhood Sexual Abuse (lodged on 10 August 2000) Cathy Jamieson*
S1M-1118 Childhood Sexual Abuse (lodged on 10 August 2000) Donald Gorrie*, Andrew Wilson*
S1M-1118 Childhood Sexual Abuse (lodged on 10 August 2000) Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Cathie Craigie*, Scott Barrie*, Elaine Smith*
S1M-1118 Childhood Sexual Abuse (lodged on 10 August 2000) Marilyn Livingstone*

S1M-1118 Pauline McNeill: Childhood Sexual Abuse-That the Parliament recognises the complex, devastating and long term effect of childhood sexual abuse on children and adult survivors; further notes that childhood sexual abuse has an immense impact on society as a whole and calls upon the Scottish Executive to develop and implement a national strategy addressing the social, health and legal implications of sexual abuse and provide central support to develop a network of agencies throughout Scotland to support survivors of sexual abuse. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Irene Oldfather, Michael Russell, Cathy Jamieson, Donald Gorrie, Andrew Wilson, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Cathie Craigie, Scott Barrie, Elaine Smith, Marilyn Livingstone, Alasdair Morgan*, Nora Radcliffe*, Robin Harper*
S1M-1118 Childhood Sexual Abuse (lodged on 10 August 2000) Michael Matheson*, Bristow Muldoon*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-1118 Childhood Sexual Abuse (lodged on 10 August 2000) Christine Grahame*, Rhoda Grant*, Malcolm Chisholm*
S1M-1118 Childhood Sexual Abuse (lodged on 10 August 2000) Dr Elaine Murray*, Ms Margaret Curran*
S1M-1118 Childhood Sexual Abuse (lodged on 10 August 2000) Trish Godman*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*

S1M-1118 Pauline McNeill: Childhood Sexual Abuse-That the Parliament recognises the complex, devastating and long term effect of childhood sexual abuse on children and adult survivors; further notes that childhood sexual abuse has an immense impact on society as a whole and calls upon the Scottish Executive to develop and implement a national strategy addressing the social, health and legal implications of sexual abuse and provide central support to develop a network of agencies throughout Scotland to support survivors of sexual abuse. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Irene Oldfather, Michael Russell, Cathy Jamieson, Donald Gorrie, Andrew Wilson, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Cathie Craigie, Scott Barrie, Elaine Smith, Marilyn Livingstone, Alasdair Morgan, Nora Radcliffe, Robin Harper, Michael Matheson, Bristow Muldoon, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Gil Paterson, Christine Grahame, Rhoda Grant, Malcolm Chisholm, Dr Elaine Murray, Ms Margaret Curran, Trish Godman, Dr Sylvia Jackson
S1M-1118 Childhood Sexual Abuse (lodged on 10 August 2000) Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*, Mary Scanlon*

S1M-1118 Pauline McNeill: Childhood Sexual Abuse—That the Parliament recognises the complex, devastating and long term effect of childhood sexual abuse on children and adult survivors; further notes that childhood sexual abuse has an immense impact on society as a whole and calls upon the Scottish Executive to develop and implement a national strategy addressing the social, health and legal implications of sexual abuse and provide central support to develop a network of agencies throughout Scotland to support survivors of sexual abuse.
